Package klotski.model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
klotski.model.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents the entire game board, containing several pieces
Author:
Jacopo Da rodda Enrico De Carli Diego Romaniello Granozio Riccardo

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Basic constructor. Initializes height and width to standard Klotski size. Initializes pieces to configuration 1

    • Board

      public Board(Piece[] pieces)
      Custom constructor that uses a custom array of pieces
      Parameters:
      pieces - the custom array of pieces that this board holds

  • Method Details

    • setConfig

      public void setConfig(int number)
      Sets configuration to the given number
      Parameters:
      number - input to set configuration to

    • setTime

      public void setTime(long time, String timeString)
      Set time in two type: long and string
      Parameters:
      time - type long to store time in millisec
      timeString - type string like mm:ss

    • setMove

      public void setMove(int number)
      Set the number of moves with the input parameter
      Parameters:
      number - input to set moves

    • setPieces

      public boolean setPieces(List<String> lines)
      Reads in a set a lines representing a board state and sets the pieces of this board to match it
      Parameters:
      lines - a List of lines with the first being the number of moves, and the rest representing the x, y, w, and h of pieces
      Returns:
      true if able to successfully read in from file, false otherwise

    • setPieces2

      public boolean setPieces2(List<String> lines)
      Reads in a set a lines representing a board state and time, sets the pieces of this board to match it and set time of previous match
      Parameters:
      lines - a List of lines with the first being the number of moves, and the rest representing the x, y, w, and h of pieces
      Returns:
      true if able to successfully read in from file, false otherwise

    • selectPiece

      public boolean selectPiece(int x, int y)
      selects the piece at the given x and y coordinates
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate of the point in the piece you want to select
      y - the y coordinate of the point in the piece you want to select
      Returns:
      true if a piece was selected, false otherwise

    • isOccupied

      public boolean isOccupied(int x, int y)
      Checks whether there is a piece occupying a given point
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate of the point to check
      y - the y coordinate of the point to check
      Returns:
      true if the point is occupied

    • movePiece

      public boolean movePiece(int direction)
      Tries to move the selected piece in the given direction and make a save of the current board every move using tm
      Parameters:
      direction - 0=up, 1=right, 2=down, 3=left
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false otherwise
